snippet: The airline, headquartered in Abu Dhabi, is looking for Asian airlines as partners to help direct the growing number of Chinese and Indian travelers to its routes.
abstract: Etihad Airways, airline headquartered in Abu Dhabi, is looking for a strategic partner in Asia to help direct the growing number of Chinese and Indian travelers to its routes; airline reports net profit of $14 million for 2011, slightly better than the break-even target it had set for the year; airline is not publicly traded.
lead_paragraph: The airline, headquartered in Abu Dhabi, is looking for Asian airlines as partners to help direct the growing number of Chinese and Indian travelers to its routes.

headline.main: Etihad Airlines Looks to China and India for Growth
headline.print_headline: A Young Abu Dhabi Air Carrier Looks to Asia for Partners

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
